The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules
The training rule on receiving respectfully

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū asakkaccaṁ piṇḍapātaṁ paṭiggaṇhanti chaḍḍetukāmā viya …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū asakkaccam piṇḍapātam paṭiggaṇhanti chaḍḍetu kāmāḥ viya pe
translated: the monks from the group of six received almsfood disrespectfully, as if wanting to throw it away. …

analyzed: sakkaccam piṇḍapātam paṭiggahessāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will receive almsfood respectfully,’ this is how you should train.”

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca asakkaccaṁ piṇḍapātaṁ paṭiggaṇhāti chaḍḍetukāmo viya, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca asakkaccam piṇḍapātam paṭiggaṇhāti chaḍḍetu kāmaḥ viya āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, receives almsfood disrespectfully, as if wanting to throw it away, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
if he does not do it on purpose;
if he is the first offender.🔽The seventh training rule is finished.
